COVID-19 Testing




 Print
 
Students, faculty, staff, and postdoctoral scholars should test if experiencing symptoms, after travel, or after exposure to COVID-19.
Faculty, staff, and postdoctoral scholars testing at home using rapid antigen tests or through their primary care provider (rapid antigen or PCR), such as Stanford Health Care, Kaiser, or another community testing site, must enter their positive results into Health Check. 
Student COVID-19 screening information is available on this page. 
Visit this page for information on what to do if you test positive for COVID-19.
Updates

For faculty, staff, and postdoctoral scholars, Color testing has ended March 24, 2023 at the conclusion of winter quarter. 
For students, Color testing will end June 18, 2023 at the conclusion of spring quarter. 
Free rapid antigen tests will continue to be provided. See the Rapid Antigen Testing section below for more information. Updated Stanford University testing locations and hours can be found on the Stanford COVID-19 testing locations flyer and location map.

Rapid Antigen Testing
The university is making rapid antigen tests available for faculty, staff, postdocs, and students at the following locations:
AFDC
489 Arguello Way, Stanford
Pick Up: 8AM – 4PM (M-F)
EH&S
484 Oak Road, Stanford
Pick Up: 8AM – 4PM (M-F)
Stanford Redwood City
900 Warrington Ave, Redwood City
Stanford RecWell Front Desk
Pick Up: 9AM – 6PM (M-F)
To pick up rapid tests, you will need your Stanford ID and cell phone. You will be asked to scan a QR code to display your pick-up authorization badge on your phone. Staff will check your badge before giving you the tests. If you don’t have a phone, a staff member will manually check your records to verify eligibility. You are able to pick up 4 kits per pickup and up to 8 kits per month.
We recommend testing after travel or attending large gatherings before returning to on-campus activities. Information on the FDA’s shelf-life extension of Flowflex brand tests can be found here and here. Faculty, staff, and postdocs can also obtain rapid antigen tests through their health insurance providers. The U.S. government is also offering 4 free rapid antigen tests per household through the mail that can be ordered here.
Group Requests for Rapid Antigen Tests (Pick-upUnits may request large quantity test pickup for workgroup, lab, or department distribution if members of the group are unable to pick up kits at Test Pick Up Sites. To request a bulk order of test kits to pick up from EH&S, please submit this form.
For Students: How to Get Started with ColorStudents will find information about Color testing here. 
Please note: Once you have received a positive COVID test, you are exempt from Color testing for 90 days. 
For questions related to Stanford’s response to COVID-19 or other health concerns, please fill out this EH&S Health Guidance form.
